title: Cyclonic Storm “FENGAL” weakens, showers and strong winds continue across Sri Lanka
byline: The Meteorology Department says the Cyclonic Storm “FENGAL” over Southwest Bay of Bengal was located about 360 km north of Trincomalee and 280km Northeast of Kankasanthurai at 11.30 p.m. November 29,2024.

title: In a shock offensive, insurgents breach Syria’s largest city for the first time since 2016
byline: Insurgents breached Syria’s largest city Friday and clashed with government forces for the first time since 2016, according to a war monitor and fighters, in a surprise attack that sent residents fleeing and added fresh uncertainty to a region reeling from multiple wars.

title: Police OIC arrested over bribery allegations
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has apprehended the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Divisional Criminal Investigation Unit of the Negombo Police Station on charges of bribery.

title: African swine fever controlled to some extent, says Veterinary Association
byline: The State Veterinary Surgeons’ Association (SVSA) has announced that the spread of African swine fever has presently been brought under control to a certain extent.

title: 75-year-old dies in house fire in Mullaitivu
byline: A 75-year-old man has tragically burned to death in a fire at his home in the Silawatta area of Mullaitivu last afternoon (29).

title: 141 Indian fishermen in Sri Lankan custody, Indian govt. informs Parliament
byline: A total of 141 Indian fisherfolk are in Sri Lankan custody, of whom 45 are under trial, the Indian government informed Parliament on Thursday.

title: Air quality drops in several areas across Sri Lanka - NBRO
byline: The air quality levels have dropped in Colombo and several other areas across the country, the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) said.

title: UK MPs back proposals to legalise assisted dying
byline: MPs have backed proposals to legalise assisted dying in England and Wales in a historic vote which paves the way for a change in the law.

title: Indian Crime Branch on the lookout for 15 bail absconders, 11 from Sri Lanka
byline: India’s Kerala Crime Branch is on the lookout for 15 foreign nationals who were arrested with forged travel documents at Nedumbassery airport and later went absconding after securing bail.

title: Up-country train services face extended disruption, to last several more days
byline: Efforts to remove earth mounds and rocks fallen to the railway tracks in the Uduwara area of Hali-Ela due to heavy rain, are still ongoing.

title: ‘Manusath Derana’ continues relief efforts for flood-affected communities in North
byline: TV Derana’s CSR initiative “Manusath Derana” has once again stepped forward to assist those impacted by the recent adverse weather conditions. Partnering with Dialog, “Manusath Derana” launched its relief operation for the second consecutive day today (30).

title: Navy officer killed in wild elephant attack
byline: An officer attached to the Sri Lanka Navy Base in Punewa has been killed following an attack by a wild elephant.

title: Landslide warnings issued for 8 districts
byline: The National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings to multiple areas in 8 districts, as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Ampara tractor accident: Body of another missing boy found
byline: The body of another student out of the six who went missing after the tractor they were traveling on toppled and was swept away by floodwaters at Karaitivu in Ampara District on Tuesday (26), has been discovered.

title: Adverse weather claims 17 lives, nearly 500,000 affected
byline: Adverse weather from a deep depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal has claimed the lives of 17 people in Sri Lanka with 20 injured so far, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Fuel prices revised
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today (30).

title: Sri Lanka better equipped to address future marine disasters - experts
byline: Marine pollution response experts claim that Sri Lanka is now better equipped with the knowledge and strategies to address future marine disasters, having learnt key lessons in that regard in the fallout of the ‘X-Press Pearl’ and ‘New Diamond’ shipwrecks.
